components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.

components.name: Metrics Ingestion
components.description: The metrics ingestion pipeline that Servers and Gateways report to, enabling support of Studio analytics and features.

components.name: Schema Publishing
components.description: The Schema Publishing feature which is leveraged by tools like Server auto-reporting, `rover graph publish`, and `rover subgraph publish`.

components.name: Schema Checks
components.description: The Schema Checks feature enabling user workflows for commands like `rover graph check`, and `rover subgraph check`.

components.name: GraphQL API
components.description: The API that supports reading metrics, schemas, client metadata, publishing and validating schemas.

components.name: Notifications
components.description: This includes features like Slack, Webhooks, and Emails.

components.name: Studio Metrics Dashboard
components.description: The features of Apollo Studio that power viewing usage of your graph. This includes the fields page, clients page, operations page, and certain screens within other main tabs of the Studio application.

components.name: (experimental) Performance Alerts
components.description: Apollo Studio feature that supports alerting to Slack or Pagerduty based on latency, error, and request rates of operations.

components.name: ApolloGraphQL.com
components.description: This includes the homepage (www.apollographql.com), docs content, and blog content.

components.name: Datadog Forwarding
components.description: A feature of Apollo Studio that allows users to forward metrics observed via Apollo's telemetry pipeline to their Datadog instance(s).

components.name: Cloud Routing
components.description: GraphOS Cloud supergraphs hosted on Apollo infrastructure

incident_updates.body: During part of this period, Routers and Gateways which use IP-based allow lists will be unable to connect to Uplink. Contact Apollo Technical Support to help mitigate this.

We apologize for the previous notification sent out in the morning of April 15, 2025, which had the incorrect dates related to this scheduled maintenance. As part of scheduled maintenance on May 19, 2025, between 17:00 UTC and 21:00 UTC to update IP addresses behind our APIs, we will be temporarily changing the IP address associated with Uplink: uplink.api.apollographql.com. The current Egress IP Address is 34.117.186.194 Customers who use IP Allow Lists to connect to Apollo, and do not update their lists to include the new IP, will be temporarily unable to access Uplink while Apollo conducts this maintenance. If you are a customer using IP Allow Lists, and have the IP Allow list updated with the new IP, there will be no downtime to any Apollo services. Required Actions if using IP Allow Lists The temporary IP address may be obtained by contacting Apollo Technical Support via our Help Center, Studio, or by emailing support@apollographql.com. Add the temporary IP to your allow list for uplink.api.apollographql.com. Keep the current IP (34.117.186.194) in your allow list, as service will return to this IP after the maintenance period. We appreciate your understanding and are committed to ensuring a smooth transition with minimal disruption. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to Apollo Technical Support.

components.name: Uplink
components.description: Studio managed Supergraph Schema Delivery. Apollo Gateway (v 0.34+) uses Uplink to fetch routing configuration dynamically from the Apollo schema registry.
